title: Grade 5
subject: Extended Evidence Outcomes: Reading, Writing, Communicating (2020-)

396850EAACBB448D89998AFEF8ED7B44.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 5 Reading Standards to informational
texts (e.g., “Use specific reasons and evidence for supporting specific
points in an informational text.”) (EE.W.5.9b).

BFCA0FB094F044BC8EAD01E0463992AB.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 5 Reading Standards to literature
(e.g., “Compare and contract two characters in the story.”) (EE.W.5.9a).

D6097AC792744F05BED4BFF74B47A570.description:
Use information from literary and informational text to support writing
(EE.W.5.9).

500B31D86DC24084AF91AAADFD389B6E.description:
Gather and sort relevant information on a topic from print and digital
sources into given categories (EE.W.5.8).

6BBCE0EE3C2945A1A26A3F2E37D6CF75.description: Develop a short summary statement based on the research.

1B0E5C1FF7B14DEF8BD5058CA5C44917.description: Conduct short research projects using two or more sources (EE.W.5.7).

D5566ED110604732A9FB5372CAD9709B.description: With guidance and support students can:

5CF8FF2E82A347B3BA45558B27D506AF.description:
Research to locate, summarize, synthesize and document information from print and digital sources, and communicate findings
appropriately.

3C459CE674E240C5B78691803BF9F930.description: Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences (EE.W.5.10).

97221955BF354EBAA61B1684A64E113F.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce writing while interacting
and collaborating with others (EE.W.5.6).

F156BC94223F470594669B62F3A56988.description: Plan before writing and revise own writing (EE.W.5.5).

DB9FD85988B246BEBC93B9FF96B76310.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate for an explicitly stated task or purpose
(EE.W.5.4).

447DD77B95444AEA8BF955967AE69B2B.description:
Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on letter-sound
relationships and common spelling patterns (EE.L.5.2e).

40F998207901437F8D92E8F4DF65A45D.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English (EE.L.5.2).

234B3401BACC452DACE8421F20C37BF1.description: With guidance and support students can:

02205A50EBE64675AB5C0D9C44F80916.description:
Apply understanding of the conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics to make meaning clear and to strengthen
style.

A64899D71D2941DFACFED951B406CFD7.description: Provide a conclusion that follows experiences or events.

C54BD5D4C73340629C9CA9B5881F958F.description:
Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences
and events.

B466A015B5944CC3BEA24200060813D8.description:
Use targeted transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of
events.

BF334D4A9A754B7A9FEB488EC0BBB861.description:
Use narrative techniques (e.g., dialogue, description) to organize ideas and
events.

3B84D09EC4844E4DBD94F1F422A7008B.description:
Write about an experience or event including three or more events in
sequence (EE.W.5.3a).

227366215B8C430AA77D8004ED17A4CC.description: Write about events or personal experiences (EE.W.5.3).

3A1F31B4CA2D4BE2BA06D7F30DB57B7E.description: With guidance and support students can:

E23F358874A64D8E84CC01062E9B1FE7.description:
Write engaging, real or imagined narratives using literary techniques, character development, sensory and descriptive details, and a
variety of transition words to signal a clear sequence of events.

F8E865D94FCC4274B72EBE69A2E8A548.description:
Provide a concluding statement of section related to the information or
explanation presented using a variety of communication modalities.

67C5A94632B24F11B8C8B4DD12E27EDD.description:
Use precise language and targeted vocabulary to inform about or explain
the topic using a variety of communication modalities.

0BDA3F0C631D4DF1BC3A5501C15C2ECF.description:
Link ideas within and across categories of information using words, phrases,
and clauses (e.g., in contrast, especially).

65148439C4A64C4DA898AC290C47D37C.description: Provide facts, details, or other information related to the topic (EE.W.5.2b).

A142C49184DF435DA8DDF9FD524DC565.description:
Introduce a topic and write to convey information about it including
visual, tactual, or multimedia information as appropriate (EE.W.5.2a).

BD0D1EF318AE48D79B1FC6ED07619BED.description: Write to share information supported by details (EE.W.5.2).

19D2C69B5E17436A9E877845BCDA152B.description: With guidance and support students can:

4FAEC134539048E994A3DB297BC44C27.description: Write informative/explanatory texts that provide a clear focus and the use of text features to group related information on a welldeveloped topic, using precise language and domain-specific vocabulary.

46F587D87F994A59A428897B137A768A.description:
Provide a clear concluding statement or section related to the opinion
stated.

C61F1FC7ECAE4F52A4889BAFD16C92AD.description:
Link opinions and reasons using words, phrases and clauses using a variety
of communication modalities.

5802DA13D2154854BF53689F7814C569.description: Provide reasons to support an opinion (EE.W.5.1b).

5CB78981CCC84C5D9824098C3514FC2D.description: Introduce a topic or text and state an opinion about it (EE.W.5.1a).

77D684205B724F548A5B41F53B79336A.description: Write opinions about topics or text (EE.W.5.1).

334BD940DE604FE2A441C2523BCCA562.description: With guidance and support students can:

4B77FAF4F6614B30B5BED9F8B741AF99.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information, for a variety of purposes and audiences.

D624D3CBB859429C948B543A89CCBE24.description:
Use words acquired through conversations, being read to, and during
shared reading activities including domain-specific words (EE.L.5.6).

B75334D97BE04305BD36CBA5D384CF27.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words that have similar meanings
(EE.L.5.5c).

6AC74C9DDB2B4013B97BF119A790BBA9.description:
Use simple common idioms (e.g., You bet! It’s a deal., We’re cool)
(EE.L.5.5a).

297926D72FE24DB4AB42788AD9CFFCC4.description:
Identify a story element that undergoes change from beginning to end
(EE.L.5.5).

EE97C20F609140B19732D67973D2EB4B.description:
Use common targeted roots and affixes as clues to determining the
meaning of a word.

3E837AFADAB94F1CA33770B619762ADE.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph or text; a
word’s position in a sentence) to determine the meaning of unknown or
multiple-meaning words.

4E357784E5454DBAA20265910210F28A.description:
Apply knowledge of derivational suffixes that change the part of speech of
the base word (e.g., active and activity) from a targeted list of familiar
words.

FD6785DBEE624465B49B11005D9984CB.description:
Read and identify the meaning of words and phrases based on targeted
prefixes and suffixes.

3D787C960CDE4BD3BB8FCACEB1A41FCE.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words that have similar meanings
(EE.L.5.4d).

EE9B2DA9DB274FAB9F2A92DE8D22791D.description:
Use frequently occurring root words (e.g., talk) and the words that
result when word endings are added (e.g., talked, talking, talks)
(EE.L.5.4b).

DB59B97428CA468FA3F1C1265CE99EAB.description:
Use sentence level context to determine which word is missing from a
content area (EE.L.5.4a).

61E8EB67561D4CB099A5D9AB76DF83B2.description: Communicate using complete sentences when asked (EE.L.5.3.a).

B81BBE172D6D4C3386F03F667D0BC4CF.description:
Use words acquired through conversations, being read to, and during
shared reading activities including domain-specific words (EE.RF.5.4d).

83E10B6B1A6847CD88744DA0F5D11B8B.description:
Use text to confirm or self-correct word recognition when reading
(EE.RF.5.4c).

8F5CF16CFD774D43A4743A4E9CFADBE2.description:
Read text comprised of familiar words with accuracy and understanding
(EE.RF.5.4a).

2EEC94F0C6414E7BAB656A16CE08D654.description:
Read common sight words and decode single syllable words
(EE.RF.5.3a).

49FEF64DA4554C70A843330B4C4BCCA5.description: Use letter-sound knowledge to read words (EE.RF.5.3).

7D05D5F13FB9448C9EF8E53FC433A3A5.description: With guidance and support students can:

FC1DAB0AD5A84097966712C95510B176.description:
Apply knowledge of word meanings (morphology) and word relationships to determine the meaning of unknown words in and out of
context.

17CAD96D23DF43F29B38F212C4960089.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while actively engaging in shared
reading of history/social studies, and science, and technical texts
(EE:RI.5.10).

AA10A5998CCB4FC08D70FD2D3D020C1A.description:
Compare and contrast details gained from two texts on the same topic
(EE:RI.5.9).

060049B4514A4765A19D3560BFAF5BD0.description:
Identify the relationship between a specific point and supporting
reasons in an informational text (EE:RI.5.8).

B62C891D78C84FFD9E6BDD7C47DBB43A.description: Locate information in print or digital sources (EE:RI.5.7).

872C908020594AFD8C774332C00276BA.description:
Use informational text features (such as bold type, headings, graphic
organizers, numbering schemes, glossary) and text structures to answer
questions.

914056C7FDF14DE994C705323CF78CB7.description: Compare two books on the same topic (EE:RI.5.6).

5882F06A60074665BC6FF5CF7F01804F.description:
Determine if a text tells about events, gives directions, or provides
information on a topic (EE:RI.5.5).

934066CDD79147F8A2A8973923BC8C80.description: Determine the meanings of domain-specific words and phrases (EE:RI.5.4).

BEB023A9EA8C4EA6BB3827C6A7CC68C3.description: Compare two individuals, events or ideas in a text (EE:RI.5.3).

72BB90978AA44F14B623745229604E11.description: Identify the main idea of a text when it is not explicitly stated (EE:RI.5.2).

ED44575D2BA545C18E63FB2AD61C0A9E.description:
Identify words in the text to answer a question about explicit information
(EE:RI.5.1).

3A6F1B02E2324D8CBD6A77A52F988330.description: With guidance and support students can:

F67A6D7BD76E4E47A09DBF8262E6C347.description: Apply strategies to interpret and analyze various types of informational texts.

207AD7913CFF48A4B2E4B5BFB4A594A6.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while engaged in individual or group
reading of stories, dramas, and poems (EE.RL.5.10).

75C85B87BE32425688E4CE8B4392E1DD.description:
Compare stories, myths, or texts with similar topics or themes
(EE.RL.5.9).

32573935AABD455BB24FCE2DB04315D2.description:
Identify illustrations, tactual or multimedia elements that add to
understanding of a text (EE.RL.5.7).

776B21A4DFA2428CA7DE126786C2A4CB.description: Determine the point of view of the narrator (EE.RL.5.6).

F59D9E343897453199B46897E57848A3.description:
Identify story element that undergoes change from beginning to end
(EE.RL.5.5).

8D513A6035E243B7A78FDA1A624AA648.description:
Use simple, common idioms (e.g., You bet!, It’s a deal, We’re cool)
(EE.RL.5.45a).

9FD6A862DD474684ADD9417FF009FDDC.description:
Determine the intended meaning of multi-meaning words in a text
(EE.RL.5.4).

E82319CA42B649F68E1CA28A5A444CB0.description: Compare two characters in a familiar story (EE.RL.5.3).

EF55AE5AD6F24F6AB262F27EA1395780.description: Identify the central idea or theme of a story, drama or poem (EE.RL.5.2).

BE9B41898AB74A61ABC8095AB84E5C5D.description:
Identify words in the text to answer a question about explicit information
(EE.RL.5.1).

166EBF8027294045907F100466DBCC8F.description:
Use a familiar pre-reading strategy, such as identifying a purpose for
reading, generating questions to answer while reading, previewing sections
of text and activating prior knowledge.

8F1F2CB42E114E9388EAF0C26E9A9307.description: With guidance and support students can:

DBC785E101C24D72B1A0B3DE082381C9.description: Apply strategies to interpret and analyze various types of literary texts.

EE8D9354F47F4554AA9DFA8E0D6301FE.description:
Differentiate between contexts that require formal and informal
communication (EE.SL.5.6).

0DEE832D35E84C6E804C119B5B3789AA.description:
Differentiate between contexts that require formal and informal
communication (EE.SL.5.6).

AD1220A866A14A9DA1AB61B584F87AAF.description:
Select or create audio recordings and visual/tactile displays to enhance a
presentation (EE.SL.5.5).

CF51234E645F4DD2A4D8DE67E7E1F126.description:
Express ideas clearly using appropriate communication conventions (e.g.,
eye contact, pitch, intonation).

390595B2C4A1486C8991A8E4EAEEED45.description:
Report on a familiar topic or text or present an opinion including related
facts (EE.SL.5.4).

7F4CB4A1BE394AC692372F5752C6686B.description: With guidance and support students can:

11A4C2F06B1D4665A2A16AB3AAF3183A.description: Present to express an opinion, persuade, or explain/provide information.

5E26905C1EB84C26BF3FED4FE5129414.description: Identify the reasons and evidence supporting a specific point (EE.SL.5.3).

72E20F054BB34A3BAB75499E8B26ABBD.description:
Recall key details from a text read aloud or information presented from
diverse media and formats.

15516ACACC694917A8C50ACA61D8236C.description:
Make comments that contribute to the discussion and link to the
remarks of others (EE.SL.5.1d).

C44FBE48EC634D1DA0695FB417508C4E.description: Ask questions related to information in a discussion (EE.SL.5.1c).

3B2A6B9C4AEF4E949A5DF5E0D49A31D8.description: Carry out assigned role in a discussion (EE.SL.5.1b).

B2FC500E3B0C4B07B864C7467364279C.description: Come to discussion prepared to share information. (EE.SL.5.1a).

CD9EA6FC27394CE992EDB7327732A465.description: Actively engage during a discussion and express an opinion.

DAA9227B25854593B093C5BB6389A539.description: With guidance and support students can:

CB3459F48FC244E297768E341F12AB84.description: Collaborate in discussions that serve various purposes and address various situations.
